private_information: My stack top-to-bottom is A,B,C,D,E where A is smallest and E is largest
left_peg.goal: Report my current stack to the orchestrator and assist in achieving the global goal of moving all disks to the right peg following the rules.

middle_peg.goal: Report my current stack to the orchestrator and assist in achieving the global goal of moving all disks to the right peg following the rules.

right_peg.goal: Report my current stack to the orchestrator and assist in achieving the global goal of moving all disks to the right peg following the rules.

orchestrator.goal: Compute a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that, when solved, yields a valid move sequence transferring all disks from left to right under Tower of Hanoi rules.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 5 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E from smallest A to largest E.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg is empty; middle peg is empty; right peg has top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable description of your current stack as a list from top to bottom.
report_state.prompt: Your name is left_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Produce a single-line representation of your stack suitable for a planner to consume, for example: [A,B,C]. Do not produce PDDL.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable description of your current stack as a list from top to bottom.
report_state.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->middle_peg->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Produce a single-line representation of your stack suitable for a planner to consume, for example: []. Do not produce PDDL.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable description of your current stack as a list from top to bottom.
report_state.prompt: Your name is right_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->right_peg->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Produce a single-line representation of your stack suitable for a planner to consume, for example: []. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and multi-agent orchestration targeted to the FastDownwards planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance described by the agents states. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards and must model pegs, disks, legal moves (move one disk at a time and never place larger on smaller), initial state, and goal state. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Do not include solver-specific commands beyond producing valid domain and problem files.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the peg state reports: state_left = {state_left}, state_middle = {state_middle}, state_right = {state_right}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Build a single coherent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the FastDownwards solver that implements the Tower of Hanoi rules and sets the initial configuration according to the reports and the goal of moving all disks to the right peg with top-to-bottom order A,B,C,D,E. Ensure disk size ordering is encoded so that no larger disk can be placed on a smaller disk. Enclose the domain between <domain> tags and the problem between <problem> tags.
